channel.title: [HELP] Chest, Key & Reward. [HELP]
channel.description: I am trying to make it so if you use crystal key, on a Silver chest, you get one item at random, from a huge list of items, I have the items I want, I have released the keys, and added the chest, all I need help on now is adding the rewards and using the key on the chest, though I don't have a clue what to do, as I have only ever added item on item gives a single item. I am using Ddsspeced and any help would be greatly apreciated!

item.title: [HELP] Chest, Key & Reward. [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @krazy_karl krazy karl
item.description:
@krazy_karl wrote:

OK I have added everything apart from this because I can’t find where to add it exactly

    public static int namehere[] = {#, #, #};

Sorry if I’m a pain…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 19, 2009, 11:36:54 am[/size][hr]Nevermind got it.

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Chest, Key & Reward. [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I might as well help you as I have nothing better to do.

You will be using a static integer for the items.

    public static int namehere[] = {#, #, #};

Replace namehere with any name you would like, and replace the #s with item ids.

Then, you need to search for your item on object packet.

case 192:

Under that, add this:

if (useItemID == @@@@ && atObjectID == ####) { addItem(namehere(), 1); }

Replace @@@@ with the ID of the crystal key.

Replace #### with the ID of the chest.

Replace namehere once again with the name you changed above.

Make sure that your brackets are matched up and you haven’t put the code in the wrong place. Post any errors you get.

Save and compile, and you’re done.

Read full topic
